metadata.title: How to Do YouTube SEO 2025: Complete Optimization Guide
metadata.description: Master YouTube SEO to rank higher in search. Titles, descriptions, tags, and optimization strategies that work.

hero.headline: How to Do YouTube SEO: Rank Higher in Search
hero.subheadline: Optimize your videos to be discovered through YouTube and Google search results.

sections.content: YouTube is the second largest search engine. Videos that rank well get consistent views for months or years. SEO isn't about gaming the system—it's about helping YouTube understand your content and match it with the right audience. This guide covers everything you need to rank.

content.title: Relevance
content.description: Does your video match what the user searched for? Titles, descriptions, and actual content matter.

content.title: Watch Time
content.description: How long do people watch? Videos that keep viewers watching rank higher.

content.title: Engagement
content.description: Likes, comments, and shares signal quality content worth recommending.

sections.title: SEO Optimization Checklist
content: Use primary keyword in title (front-load if possible)
Encourage engagement at end of video

sections.title: Description Optimization Tips
content: First 2-3 sentences are critical (visible before expand)

faq.question: How important are tags for YouTube SEO?
faq.answer: Less important than before. YouTube says tags have 'minimal' impact. Still worth using—put your primary keyword first, add 5-10 relevant variations.

faq.question: Does speaking keywords help SEO?
faq.answer: Yes. YouTube transcribes audio and uses it for understanding content. Naturally mentioning your topic helps YouTube categorize your video.

faq.question: How long until SEO kicks in?
faq.answer: Videos can rank immediately or take months. Initial performance often improves as YouTube learns more about your video's audience fit.

faq.question: Should I optimize old videos?
faq.answer: Yes. Updating titles, thumbnails, and descriptions can revive underperforming videos. Monitor for improvements after changes.
